I definitely agree with both of you (Tiffany/Sherlgirl)... When I 
first started watching the series I definitely felt something there. 
Ayunee possibly attracted to Hijikata. Still though I think that the 
feeling was mutual. Just look at Hijikata's reaction to her death. I 
would think there was more than just a feeling of "responsibility".  
There were subtle yaoi tendecies between Hijikata and Okita but IMHO 
the attraction between the two was more apparent, maybe not at the 
same time.. Of course I could be wrong... Oh well...

As for writing a story between the two of them...  Just like 
Sherlgirl I'd been toying with the idea but afraid to do so at the 
moment for so many reasons. :O)

I hope someone picks up the pairing soon. ^_-


--- In SHQ_Spy_Division@yahoogroups.com, sherlgirl <sherlgirl@m...> 
wrote:
> Tiffany - 
> 
> 
> Do we need spoiler space?
> 
> :-)
> 
> 
> .
> .
> .
> .
> .
> .
> .
> .
> 
> 
> 
> Glad I wasn't the only one reading something into that scene. I 
suspected from the  way Ayunee and her brother talked earlier in the 
series that she had some deep connection to Hijikata.
> 
> THe goodbye scene was more subtle.... perhaps it was the fact that 
this conversation occurred while he was washing and her subdued way 
of speaking that made me think that both were at least aware of her 
feelings.   
> 
> What puzzled me most , however, was the way Hijikata did not show 
up normally to grieve her.  Was he simply angry? Or deeply and 
personally upset?
> 
> This is actually the one fanfic idea I had kicked around as far as 
writing.  I'm reluctant to at the moment because my hands are too 
full.   I would not mind one of you writers taking on the idea, 
however. ^_^
> 
> S
